input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Other specified congenital hearing impairment

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE 8 YEARS OLD AND YOUR BIOLOGICAL GENDER IS FEMALE
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Impairment of auditory function (difficulty hearing soft sounds and certain frequencies)
- Issues with social and language development (struggling to follow conversations and respond appropriately)
- Noticeable difficulty hearing when there is background noise
- Some delay in speech development compared to peers
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION:
Gradually over the past six months, I’ve started to notice that I can’t hear my teacher’s soft voice at school or hear my friends whispering during play. Sometimes I don’t respond because I didn’t hear what was said, even when I try to listen closely. My parents say I’ve been slower to talk and sometimes I seem to misunderstand what people say. I don’t remember any specific injury or loud noise exposure, but I know my family has a history of hearing issues.
output:
THINKING: The doctor is asking why I'm here, so I should explain what's been happening. I feel a little shy but also a bit worried because I can't hear well and it's been hard to play with my friends or listen 
ANSWER: Um, I think I can't hear good sometimes, like when my teacher talks soft or when my friends whisper, I don’t always catch what they say. My mom and dad say I talk a little slower than other kids too. It’s been like this for a while, like, maybe six months or more.
thinking: The doctor is asking why I'm here, so I should explain what's been happening. I feel a little shy but also a bit worried because I can't hear well and it's been hard to play with my friends or listen
answer: Um, I think I can't hear good sometimes, like when my teacher talks soft or when my friends whisper, I don’t always catch what they say. My mom and dad say I talk a little slower than other kids too. It’s been like this for a while, like, maybe six months or more.

behavior_config.description: Patient initially omits embarrassing or stigmatized symptoms
